Notice

This event has been released in the Global server and its relevant stories are now available in the Archives. As such, the contents of this page and the related subpages have been archived.

Adventure That Cannot Wait for the Sun, subtitled Inudi Harek, Horakhet,[note 1] is the thirtieth Side Story and fourth Carnival event in Arknights.

    • 1.1 Citizen's Garden
    • 1.2 Harvest Gathering

Additions[edit]

New mechanics: Crystal

New devices:

  • Decrystallizing Totem
  • Pure Crystal

New enemies:

Normal
Elite
Boss

Operators[edit]

  • [Global] Savage will be given for free to players who didn't have her (through an in-game mail) by logging in for the first time from the start of the event; those who already have her will receive a Savage's Token to improve her Potential instead.
  • The following Operators will gain 50% more Trust (except from Annihilation):
  • Operator Modules added for Wandering Medics.
  • Nightingale receives the RIN-Y Module.
  • Kal'tsit and Phantom receives the ISW-α Module.

Headhunting[edit]

Main article: Headhunting/Banners/Former-2025

The fourth Carnival limited headhunting banner, Engraver of Quicksand, is featured.

  • A single Bright Glitter Headhunting Permit can be claimed while the Engraver of Quicksand banner is up.
  • Every day, the player can perform one headhunting pull for free at the Engraver of Quicksand banner. Note that the free pulls do not stack, so it must be used before the daily reset.

Recruitment[edit]

The following Operators are added to the recruitment pool:

Note that all current tags will be refreshed once the recruitment pool is updated.

Store[edit]

  • [Global] The double bonus for Originite Prime packs will be reset from the start of the event.
  • [Global] Invisible Dirge is now available for purchase in Distinctions Store and Universal Certificates Exchange Area.
  • Monthly Battle Record and Funding Packs are added to Packs Store.
  • The following packs are available in the Packs Store until February 13, 2025:

Outfits[edit]

The following outfits are available in the Outfit Store until February 13, 2025:

New
Re-edition

Fashion Review[edit]

The Fashion Review is updated with the following outfits:

Furniture[edit]

  • The "Under The Sandbank" Luxury Suite, Bunny Bonanza, and Ha'maimenat Garden furniture themes are available.
    • The first two are available in the Furniture Store until February 13, 2025.
    • Some of the latter's parts are awarded from Event Guidebook missions while others are available in the Grand Bazaar and the Furniture Store until February 13, 2025.
  • The Midnight Blue Self-Service Bar replaces the Catastrophe Observatory as the Lucky Drop of most operations, which is now available in the Furniture Store.

Miscellaneous[edit]

  • [Global] The Celebration Home Screen background will be unlocked for players who logged into the game during the event if not already.
  • [Global] A Senior Operator Transfer Permit can be claimed by logging into the game for the first time from when the event starts.
  • [Global] Record Restoration added for Ideal City in January 30, 2025.
  • [Global] New Records medal: "Five Years of Hope and Reminiscence"

Operator Records/Paradox Simulations[edit]

New Operator Records and/or Paradox Simulations are added for the following Operators:

Operator Operator Record(s) Paradox Simulation

Not added Against the Storm

Sun in the Mine Unstoppable Force

Before the Spilling Sunlight Not added

The First Step Into Night A Scholar's Strength

In Kazdel Army Of One

Songs of Old Unseen Weapon

Things Left Behind Not added

Bazaar Wishing Wall[edit]

Until January 30, 2025, the player will be able to pick two out of ten Wishing Tickets every day, which gives Orundum with the highest among the picked ones being the reward (e.g. if the first Ticket gives 400 and the second gives 800 , then the player will receive the latter).

  • The possible Orundum values in each Wishing Ticket are 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 800.
  • If the player receives less than 400 from the Wishing Ticket, they will be able to pick a third Ticket in the next day.
  • All unused Wishing Ticket picks do not stack, so they must be used before the daily reset.

CVs[edit]

[Global] New English CVs added for the following Operators:

Operator CV

Ama Lee
Chris Naoki Lee
Skyler Davenport
Lizzie Freeman
Katelyn Gault

Media[edit]

Trivia[edit]

  • Adventure That Cannot Wait for the Sun is the first Carnival event that neither feature Alternate Operators nor be set in a watery environment.
  • With 38 characters and 7 words, the English title is the longest of all events in Arknights, above Come Catastrophes or Wakes of Vultures which also has 38 characters but with only 6 words.
  • The medals in the trailer are arranged in the shape of a gem or jewel.
  • In the CN server, Adventure That Cannot Wait for the Sun is preceded by A Kazdelian Rescue and the release of Sarkaz's Furnaceside Fables. Since Furnaceside Fables could not be released in the Global server until at least after the release of its Expansion II in CN, and its release date of January 9, 2025 being too close to Global's 5th anniversary on January 16, 2025 which has to be covered by AS as a Carnival event, So Long, Adele Rerun is instead released as the event preceding AS while the release of KR and Furnaceside Fables are delayed to succeed AS on February 7, 2025 and February 14, 2025, respectively instead.

Notes[edit]

  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 Ancient Egyptian for "Hail to Thee, Horakhty" (j.nḏ ḥr ḥr-ꜣḫtj)
